oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NEW APPROACH TO CYCLOPHANES CONTAINING ETHYLENEOXY BRIDGE BY GLASER-EGLINTON COUPLING
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
WAGHULE, GT
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DIVERSITY-ORIENTED APPROACH
RING-CLOSING METATHESIS
DIELS-ALDER REACTION
AMINO-ACID DERIVATIVES
ENYNE METATHESIS
KEY STEPS
ALKYNE METATHESIS
CROWN-ETHERS
MACRO RINGS
RONGALITE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three strategies have been explored to generate cyclophane derivatives. In this regard, we identified alkyne metathesis, Diels-Alder reaction, and Glaser-Eglinton coupling as key steps. To this end, cyclophane derivatives containing ethyleneoxy bridge were successfully synthesized in four steps involving Glaser-Eglinton coupling and catalytic hydrogenation sequence.
